textAfterTable: 8 Songs Biography Born: February 10, 1954 in Kingston, Jamaica Genre: Reggae Years Active: '70s, '80s, '90s, '00s One of Jamaica's most popular DJs, Trinity was omnipresent in the roots age, flooding the sound systems with versions and full-length albums. Born Wade Brammer in Kingston, Jamaica, on February 10, 1954, he attended the legendary Alpha School for Boys. Initially taking the moniker Prince Glen, in 1974 the toaster cut his first sides for Winston Edwards, several in combo with close friend Dillinger.
